intro: Wikstroemia sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in clusters. It is well adapted to the tropical climate and is often found in dry, sandy soils. The species is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its beauty.
